Bride, Groom, Spy: How Wedding Detectives Are Running Matrimonial Industry - NDTV
summary:
The Rise of Wedding Detectives in India's Matrimonial Industry

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: NDTV

As more couples in India opt for love marriages instead of arranged ones, the demand for wedding detectives is growing. These professionals help families ensure that their children's prospective partners are suitable through discreet investigations.

  • The cost of hiring a wedding detective ranges from $100 to $2,000.
  • Families are increasingly turning to detectives to vet potential sons and daughters-in-law.
  • Matrimonial detective Bhavna Paliwal mentions that her agency handles about eight cases a month.
  • Investigations can reveal discrepancies, such as one case where a man claimed an annual salary of $70,700 but was actually earning $7,070.
  • Concerns around relationships, including fidelity and background, have made pre-marital checks common.
  • Private eyes also face challenges accessing properties due to modern security measures.
  • Advancements in technology have made it easier and safer for detectives to conduct surveillance.
“No relationship can work on the basis of lies.” - Bhavna Paliwal

The increasing complexity of relationships and societal changes in India have made the role of wedding detectives vital in navigating the changing matrimonial landscape.
newTitle: The Rise of Wedding Detectives in India's Matrimonial Industry

title: Vinod Kambli earns less pension than the pension of these cricketers' fathers - India.com
summary:
Vinod Kambli Earns Less Pension Compared to Cricketers' Fathers

Published on: Date not specified, Source: India.com

In this article, we explore the pension disparity faced by former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli in comparison to the fathers of young cricket stars like Samit Dravid and Arjun Tendulkar.

  • Vinod Kambli's pension is lower than that of cricketers' fathers.
  • Arjun Tendulkar's father, Sachin Tendulkar, receives Rs 70,000 per month.
  • Kambli has faced health challenges including two heart attacks.
  • Despite a net worth of Rs 13 crore in the past, Kambli's financial situation seems dire.
  • Rahul Dravid, Samit Dravid's father, also receives a pension of Rs 70,000.
  • The disparity raises questions about support for former cricketers.
"The pension disparity highlights the need for a review of BCCI's support for retired players."

This situation emphasizes the broader issues of financial support for retired athletes and raises awareness regarding the treatment of former players by governing bodies.
newTitle: Vinod Kambli Earns Less Pension Compared to Cricketers' Fathers

WTC Final Scenarios: What are India's chances if Border-Gavaskar Trophy ends in a draw? - The Times of India
summary:
WTC Final Scenarios: What are India's chances if Border-Gavaskar Trophy ends in a draw?

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

The India-Australia Test series stands at a tense crossroads following the rain-affected draw in the third Test in Brisbane. With the five-match series level at 1-1, the remaining games in Melbourne and Sydney will be decisive, not just for the series outcome but also for the World Test Championship (WTC) Final qualification scenarios.

  • Scenario 1: Series Ends 2-2: India will have a percentage points tally (PCT) of 55.26%. Requires Australia to lose to Sri Lanka by at least 1-0 or South Africa to lose 2-0 to Pakistan.
  • Scenario 2: Series Ends 1-1: India's PCT drops to 53.51%. Requires South Africa to lose 2-0 to Pakistan or Australia to either lose 1-0 to Sri Lanka or draw with them.

India’s performance in the remaining Tests will be crucial, heavily influenced by external results as well as their consistency in batting and bowling.
newTitle: India's Chances in WTC Final if Border-Gavaskar Trophy Ends in a Draw

title: R Ashwin "Hurt, Unhappy, Deserved Better": Kapil Dev's Explosive Claim - NDTV Sports
summary:
R Ashwin "Hurt, Unhappy, Deserved Better": Kapil Dev's Explosive Claim

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

Kapil Dev has expressed shock and disappointment at R Ashwin's unexpected retirement from international cricket, suggesting he deserved a better farewell.

  • Kapil Dev emphasized that Ashwin's decision to retire was surprising, especially following a draw against Australia.
  • He expressed a sense of hurt seeing Ashwin unhappy, stating a fitting farewell on home soil would have been more appropriate.
  • Kapil highlighted Ashwin's significant contributions to Indian cricket, noting he played 106 Tests and remarked on his unique bowling style.
  • He hopes the BCCI will organize a grand farewell for Ashwin, reinforcing his impact on the sport.
“Only a champion is not insecure, and Ashwin was a champion. He has given us great joy. I wish him all the joy of the world.” - Kapil Dev

In conclusion, Kapil Dev's reflections on Ashwin's career underscore the immense respect and admiration he holds for the player, marking a significant transition in Ashwin's cricket journey.

title: Champions Trophy 2025 To Follow Hybrid Model, PCB Gets Reciprocal Arrangement And 2028 Women's T20 World Cu - News18
summary:
ICC Confirms Hybrid Model For Champions Trophy 2025, India To Play Matches At Neutral Venue

Last Updated: December 19, 2024, 21:32 IST

In a major development, the ICC has confirmed that the 2025 Champions Trophy will be played in a Hybrid Model, allowing India to play their matches at a neutral venue due to security concerns over playing in Pakistan.

  • The tournament will feature eight teams, including India, Australia, England, New Zealand, South Africa, Afghanistan, Bangladesh, and hosts Pakistan.
  • The schedule for the tournament will be announced soon.
  • This decision aligns with the ICC's agreement that India and Pakistan matches during ICC events in the 2024-2027 cycle will occur at neutral venues.
  • The PCB has also been awarded hosting rights for the ICC Women’s T20 World Cup in 2028, which will follow the same model.
“The Champions Trophy was last held in 2017 when Pakistan defeated India to win their maiden title.”

The tournament is set for February-March 2025, with speculation around Sri Lanka co-hosting and the UAE as a likely venue for Indian matches.
newTitle: Champions Trophy 2025 To Follow Hybrid Model

title: Champions Trophy signs good as Pakistan clinch historic South Africa series - ICC Cricket
summary:
Champions Trophy signs good as Pakistan clinch historic South Africa series

Publication Date: Not available | Source: Not available

Pakistan has sent a strong message ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy with an impressive 81-run victory over South Africa, securing five consecutive ODI series wins.

  • Pakistan scored 329 runs with notable contributions from Rizwan (80), Babar Azam (73), and Kamran Ghulam (63).
  • Shaheen Afridi and Naseem Shah led the bowling attack, claiming four and three wickets respectively.
  • This victory marks Pakistan as the first Asian team to win three ODI series in South Africa.
  • Pakistan aims to defend their Champions Trophy title, having previously won in 2017.
  • Captain Mohammad Rizwan praised the team's performance and highlighted Kamran Ghulam's impactful innings.
“As a captain, it’s always a great feeling to see such a performance,” - Mohammad Rizwan

This victory continues to build momentum for Pakistan as they prepare for next year's Champions Trophy.
newTitle: Pakistan Clinches Historic ODI Series Against South Africa Ahead of Champions Trophy

title: How Smriti Mandhana and Richa Ghosh put to sword West Indies’ attack for a famous series win - The Indian Express
summary:
How Smriti Mandhana and Richa Ghosh put to sword West Indies’ attack for a famous series win

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: The Indian Express

The Indian women’s cricket team celebrated a notable victory against the West Indies in Navi Mumbai, winning by 60 runs in a T20I series decider. Smriti Mandhana and Richa Ghosh shone with impressive batting performances, leading India to their highest total in women's T20Is.

  • India scored 217 runs for the loss of 4 wickets, setting a record for the highest WT20I total.
  • Smriti Mandhana broke the record for the most 50-plus scores in women’s T20Is.
  • Richa Ghosh equaled the record for the fastest T20I fifty by an Indian woman, achieving it in just 18 balls.
  • The team secured a series victory at home for the first time in five years.
A 60-run victory in the Third and Final T20I! 🥳#TeamIndia win the decider in style and complete a 2⃣-1⃣ series victory 👏👏

India's triumph not only reflects their improved performance but also sets the stage for future competitions. The contributions of Mandhana and Ghosh serve as a promising sign for the team's prospects ahead.
newTitle: Mandhana and Ghosh Lead India to Historic T20I Series Win Against West Indies
